channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump cannot use Alien Enemies Act to deport Venezuelan gang members, appeals court rules
item.description: The administration deported people designated as Tren de Aragua members to a notorious prison in El Salvador where, it argued, U.S. courts could not o...

item.title: With federal money in doubt, California's high-speed train seeks a new path forward
item.description: The leaders of California's high-speed rail project say they've learned from past mistakes. But the troubled megaproject faces an uncertain future wit...

item.title: 'Founders Museum' from White House and PragerU blurs history, AI-generated fiction
item.description: Historians say it's good to highlight America's founders, but the project takes too narrow a view of history.

item.title: Hitler's bunker is now just a parking lot. But it's a 'dark tourism' attraction anyway
item.description: Why evil histories sell. A visit to Hitler's bunker, and a deep dive into the economics and ethical quandaries of "dark tourism."

item.title: Missouri Legislators To Start Special Session on Redistricting
item.description: The lawmakers, led by a Republican majority, are expected to consider new maps that would help Republicans gain another seat in Congress. They already...

item.title: An Intensified Push for the Epstein Files, and Google’s Big Monopoly Ruling
item.description: Plus, a post-mortem on the summer box office.

item.title: Dan Kleban Joins Maine Democratic Primary, Seeking to Unseat Senator Susan Collins
item.description: Dan Kleban enters a crowded Democratic primary as party leaders wait for Maine’s Democratic governor, Janet Mills, who is “seriously considering” a ru...

item.title: So um, why do we say 'um' so much?
item.description: Who knew two letters could spark so much conversation? This week, we're breaking down the many uses of "um" and why the word is so controversial.

item.title: The Endangered Leopard Frog That Lives Next to an NYC Amazon Warehouse
item.description: The Atlantic Coast leopard frog, first identified in an industrial section of Staten Island in 2012, is now on the state’s endangered species list. Co...

item.title: A Timeline of Legal Battles Over Trump’s Use of the Alien Enemies Act
item.description: Challenges to the administration’s use of the 18th-century wartime law have gone all the way to the Supreme Court. Here’s where they stand.

item.title: The Communist Warrior Stranded for Decades in an ‘American Colony’
item.description: Ahn Hak-sop was captured during the Korean War by the South and imprisoned for more than 40 years. Now 95, he wants to return to the North to die.

item.title: Xi Parades Firepower to Signal That China Won’t Be Bullied Again

item.title: China’s Military Spectacle
item.description: China used a parade of fighter jets, missiles and goose-stepping troops to honor the country’s wartime sacrifice and issue a defiant warning to rivals...

item.title: In Yellowstone, Migratory Bison Reawaken a Landscape
item.description: A recent study hints at the potential benefits of restoring bison to an ecosystem.

item.title: Claudia Sheinbaum Walks a Political Tightrope as Rubio Visits Mexico
item.description: U.S. pressure to crack down on corrupt politicians has squeezed President Claudia Sheinbaum of Mexico ahead of her meeting with Secretary of State Mar...
